revised_title: Influence of Electric Fluid on Glass and Electrophorus: Experiments and Observations
tldr: This article presents experiments that support Dr. Ingenhousz's theory of the electrophorus and demonstrate the impermeability of glass to electric fluid. The author, William Henly, investigates various phenomena related to electricity and magnetism, providing evidence that the electric fluid does not permeate glass and that bodies are affected differently by the fluid acting through glass or directly.
